qas.question: How many things did Microsoft alter after Release Preview?
When was the General Availablity Cumulative Update provided?
How are system improvements released through Windows 8?
What name did Windows Explorer change to?
How many things did Microsoft alter before Release Preview?
When wasn't the General Availablity Cumulative Update provided?
How aren't system improvements released through Windows 8?
How are system improvements released through Windows 9?
What name did Windows Explorer stay as?

context: <a0_0><b4_0>Relatively few<b4_0/><a0_0/> changes were made from the Release Preview to the final version; these included updated versions of its pre-loaded apps, the renaming of Windows Explorer to <a3_0><b8_0>File Explorer<b8_0/><a3_0/>, the replacement of the Aero Glass theme from Windows Vista and 7 with a new flat and solid-colored theme, and the addition of new background options for the Start screen, lock screen, and desktop. Prior to its general availability on October 26, 2012, updates were released for some of Windows 8's bundled apps, and a "General Availability Cumulative Update" (which included fixes to improve performance, compatibility, and battery life) was released on Tuesday, <a1_0><b5_0>October 9, 2012<b5_0/><a1_0/>. Microsoft indicated that due to improvements to its testing infrastructure, general improvements of this nature are to be released more frequently <a2_0>through <b6_0><b7_0>Windows Update<b7_0/><b6_0/><a2_0/> instead of being relegated to OEMs and service packs only.
